item.title: Ticket #113 (Post content 'lost' if multiple <!--more--> (more...) tags used.) updated
item.dc:creator: tormodh
item.description:
Fix should be:

$allcontent = ""; for ($counter = 1; $counter < count($content); $counter++) {

$allcontent .= $content[$counter];

} if ($more) {

$output .= '<a id="more-'.$id.'"></a>'.$allcontent;

Three errors. Counting beyond array with <= Adding to wrong variable $count Only using last content ($allcontent = $content[$counter];)

Sorry. Tired.

item.title: Ticket #113 (Post content 'lost' if multiple <!--more--> (more...) tags used.) created
item.dc:creator: tormodh
item.description:
In file /wp-includes/template-functions-post.php line 117:

$content = explode('<!--more-->', $content);

explode() splits $content into number of '<!--more-->' + 1 parts. Only $content[0] and $content[1] is used. If, for any reason, more '<!--more--> tags get in the post, content after the secont is not displayed.

item.title: Ticket #108 (I get an XML Parsing Error whenever i got to my journals rss feeds) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
It seems that something, somewhere, is echoing a space before the <?xml ?> processing entity. Have a look through your wp-blog-header.php file, that's the only other file being included.

Or, if you have a particulary strict PHP running on your server, it could be the line break before the line

<?php echo '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="' . $charset . '"?'.'>'; ?>

on line 13.

edited on: 06-22-04 16:33

item.title: Ticket #100 (Support for a "keywords" field) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I've found a workaround. The problem with it is that to have "nice" keywords support, I have had to edit edit-post.php and post.php.

The current interface for adding meta information is a bit painful if you're going to be adding the same bits of meta to each post. (Select the correct field name, enter info, submit, repeat.)

My suggestion is to add a "keywords" field proper to the admin interface, even if it means the keywords are stored as meta.

item.title: Ticket #77 (When http://rpc.pingomatic.com/ is down posting something can have ...) updated
item.dc:creator: Sebbi
item.description: And it happened again ... pingomatic.com is unreachable (22.6.04 - 15:05 GMT) and i got timeout/unreachable errors in my wp-post.php, but the post appears on my website ... there really should be an error message ... that would help keeping me from pressing the publish-button over and over again, resulting in zillion postings which all look the same :-)

item.title: Ticket #100 (Support for a "keywords" field) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
Keywords are just one kind of post meta field. The post meta function that wordpress offers can accomodate more than just one kind of post meta field. You can use a new meta item called Keywords after creating it.

If this answer satisfies your requirements, please close this bug.

item.title: Ticket #109 (import-mt fatal error) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description: You might want to try splitting the file into file sof sixe < ~800Kb and importing the entries. The size restriction and the memory restriction is due to your server, and this problem has be recorded on the support forums before.

item.description: permalink_single() no longer exists. Need to update documentation.

item.title: Ticket #86 (Plugin Actions do not produce output on bookmarklet.php) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Status changed

Do you mean the admin_footer action? Since bookmarklet.php does not include admin-footer.php, the do_action for admin_footer is not getting called. bookmarklet.php can either be changed to use admin-footer.php or directly perform the do_action. Can you try one of those and let us know if that fixes it? The easiest approach would probably be to add the following right before the closing body tag.

<?php do_action('admin_footer', ); ?>

item.title: Ticket #108 (I get an XML Parsing Error whenever i got to my journals rss feeds) updated
item.dc:creator: michel v
item.description:
This is not about umlauts. It's about <?xml being preceded by a space character.

Make sure you're using the wp-rss2.php file from a fresh install and that you did not edit it in any way.

item.title: Ticket #107 (HTML Tags should be stripped from title attribute from anchor tag) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When HTML tags are added to the title of a post, these tags get carried through to the 'title' attribute of the link. This causes the XHTML validation to fail. These tags should be stripped out the same way they are being stripped out for the RSS generation.

item.description: As stated in this thread: â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/3/7655 I seem not to be the only one whose pingbacks don't work after editing a post. Also, when a post is posted, and a new link is added after an edit, it doesn't pingback it even if the "PingBack the URI's in this post" box is ticked...

item.description:
Various permalink template tags that claim to accept a template filename as an argument, don't work. They don't seem to use the argument in any obviouse way. Examples: <?php permalink_link('alt-template.php') ?> should load the post using alt-template.php but instead uses index.php

item.title:
Ticket #103 (
and
tags entered in posts invalidate XHTML 1.0 Transitional) updated
item.dc:creator: Bard09
item.description:
I can't seem to edit my own bug report. [HR] and [BR] tags are the tags I am indicating, as WP wraps them with [P] automatically.

edited on: 06-21-04 05:16

item.title:
Ticket #103 (
and
tags entered in posts invalidate XHTML 1.0 Transitional) created
item.dc:creator: Bard09
item.description:
It's pretty simple to reproduce:

Put <hr /> or <br /> on a new line in a post. Wordpress automatically encloses the tags with <p></p> tags, creating this, <p><hr /></p>, which is unfortunately invalid XHTML 1.0 Transitional.

Using your own <p></p> tags lets you put <br /> tags inside, but <hr /> tags must be placed outside to validate as XHTML.

This is a minor bug (if considered a bug at all) but it is rather frustrating. A PHP script that detects if <hr /> or <br /> is on a new line and skips wrapping it with <p></p> tags would work.
